content: quote: I can tell you about Lion's Drag Strip in the old days of the bleach burnout. "UNDER THE LIGHTS AT LIONS!! BE THERE!!!" Often heard, shouted actually, on LA am stations like KRLA back in the early sixties. I never made it to "the beach" in Long Beach damn it. Did get to Orange County, Irwindale, Pomona...

title: who would like to meet up at Woodburn drag races?

content: I was there for the last race on the last night and I never really got back into the whole drag racing fan thing again. I lived about two miles from LIONS in "Northtown" North Long Beach. I could walk down to the railroad tracks that ran between Long Beach and "North", follow the tracks for a mile and a half turn left and be at the drag strip. More often than not I and my buddies slipped under the fence and saved our money for Soda Pop and Hot dogs. We all shared and some were real good at begging for pit passes. Kenny was a short kid with a baby face who could go from 14 to 10 real quick and get some real nice stuff from sympathetic ladies. After the last race, we tore up the starting line and everyone of us carried a chunk of the track home that night. I started spending more time in Idaho and then went in the military. I used to drive by the entrance on my way to visit my Grandmother in Carson and saw what was beginning to look like a storage lot for construction materials. I think Lions has the distinction of being one of the first "official" drag strips for that area and in the country. The big funny cars are what killed it for the locals though. Navy housing not far off and the official complaints from some higher ups as well. Nothing last forever man. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

content: Hey Lorie, sounds like fun, I don't think I can make it down there. If you can get a job at Whidy that would be good, supposed to be a good place to work. Haven't heard anything about Bangor as for as civilian jobs, they have a large number of ciivilian positions there. Silverdale, WA. is close to Bangor, there shopping centers there as well as some good restaurants. If ya get there, ya gotta try the Silver City Restaurant and Brewery. Good food, good service, I understand the beer they make is good! You can Google them! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: I was there for the last race on the last night and I never really got back into the whole drag racing fan thing again. I lived about two miles from LIONS in "Northtown" North Long Beach. I could walk down to the railroad tracks that ran between Long Beach and "North", follow the tracks for a mile and a half turn left and be at the drag strip. More often than not I and my buddies slipped under the fence and saved our money for Soda Pop and Hot dogs. We all shared and some were real good at begging for pit passes. Kenny was a short kid with a baby face who could go from 14 to 10 real quick and get some real nice stuff from sympathetic ladies. After the last race, we tore up the starting line and everyone of us carried a chunk of the track home that night. I started spending more time in Idaho and then went in the military. I used to drive by the entrance on my way to visit my Grandmother in Carson and saw what was beginning to look like a storage lot for construction materials. I think Lions has the distinction of being one of the first "official" drag strips for that area and in the country. The big funny cars are what killed it for the locals though. Navy housing not far off and the official complaints from some higher ups as well. Nothing last forever man. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
